alert.note: Alert for Wibaux (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 4:32PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wibaux, east central Prairie and southern Dawson Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 431 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of West Glendive, or 11 miles south of Glendive, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glendive, Wibaux, Intake, West Glendive, Carlyle, Hoyt, Hodges, Forest Park, Stipek, Marsh, Saint Phillip and Yates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Montana.
